alert.note: Alert for Miami (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 7:17PM EDT until June 12 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CHAMPAIGN...NORTHWESTERN CLARK AND EAST CENTRAL MIAMI COUNTIES... At 717 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near New Carlisle, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Urbana, New Carlisle, St. Paris, Christiansburg, North Hampton, Tremont City, Casstown, Thackery, Westville, Haven View, Millerstown, Terre Haute, Lawrenceville, Dialton and Buck Creek State Park. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. To report severe weather, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
